data.chText: 程序；仪规；礼节；（尤指）宗教仪式
data.enText: a series of actions that are always performed in the same way, especially as part of a religious ceremony

data.chText: 她反对有组织宗教的仪规。
data.enText: She objects to the ritual of organized religion.
something that is done regularly and always in the same way

data.chText: 星期天，和姻亲们共进午餐已经成了例行的公事。
data.enText: Sunday lunch with the in-laws has become something of a ritual.
done as part of a ritual or ceremony

data.chText: 习惯的；老套的；例行公事的
data.enText: always done or said in the same way, especially when this is not sincere

ex.chText: 这是一场别开生面的婚礼。
ex.enText: This is an entirely new sort of wedding ceremony.

synonyms.bx: 指用于婚礼、葬礼等严格履行一定程序的重要典礼。

ex.chText: 这一节日起源于宗教仪式。
ex.enText: This festival originates from a religious rite.

ex.chText: 举行这类传统仪式的只有村里的女人。
ex.enText: Such traditional rites are performed only by the women of the village.

synonyms.bx: 指总以同一种方式举行的宗教仪式。

ex.chText: 许多美国家庭在饭前祈祷。
ex.enText: Many American families make a ritual of praying before meals.

ex.chText: 一场荒唐的外交上的例行公事将再次进行。
ex.enText: A ridiculous diplomatic ritual will play out once again.

synonyms.bx: 指宗教仪式，也可指反复进行的习惯性活动。

ex.enText: The service was held in the church.

ex.chText: 感恩节礼拜仪式将在小教堂举行。
ex.enText: The thanksgiving service will be held in the chapel.

synonyms.bx: 尤指在教堂举行的正式的宗教仪式。

tr: the prescribed procedure for conducting religious ceremonies
of or relating to or employed in social rites or rituals
example: sedate little colonial tribe with its ritual tea parties"- Nadine Gordime

tr: of or relating to or characteristic of religious rituals

value.def: A ritual is a religious service or other ceremony which involves a series of actions performed in a fixed order.

example.ex: This is the most ancient, and holiest of the Shinto rituals...
example.tran: 这是最古老、最神圣的神道教仪式。

example.ex: These ceremonies were already part of pre-Christian ritual in Mexico.
example.tran: 这些仪式已经成为墨西哥基督教时期以前的宗教仪式的一部分。

value.def: Ritual activities happen as part of a ritual or tradition.

example.ex: The statue was ritually bathed and purified.
example.tran: 作为仪式对这座雕塑进行冲洗和净化。

value.def: A ritual is a way of behaving or a series of actions which people regularly carry out in a particular situation, because it is their custom to do so.

example.ex: The whole Italian culture revolves around the ritual of eating...
example.tran: 整个意大利的文化都以饮食习惯为中心。

example.ex: Cocktails at the Plaza was a nightly ritual of their sophisticated world.
example.tran: 到广场饭店喝鸡尾酒是他们这个高雅时髦的圈子中的人每晚必做的事情。

value.def: You can describe something as a ritual action when it is done in exactly the same way whenever a particular situation occurs.

example.ex: I realized that here the conventions required me to make the ritual noises.
example.tran: 我意识到此时按照惯例我应该说些客套话。

value.tran: 例行公事般的;习惯性的;老规矩的
